page.title: 04WILDLIFE AROUND STANFORD
page.content: Foxes,Badgers,Stoats,Field Voles, Shrews and Woodmice are sometimes seen.Hedgehogs are more common.Frogs, Toads and Newts are found in many damp areas eg ponds,dykes and ditches. On the coast Shellduck,Wigeon,Curlew, Blackheaded Gulls,Knot,Dunlin,Grey Plovers,Bartailed Godwits and Sanderling are found in varying numbers.Corn Buntings,Yellow and Grey Wagtails may also be seen.In the reed beds around dykes and pits Bearded Tits and Water Rail can be seen. Snow Buntings, Brentgeese, Fieldfare and Redwing are annual visitors to this area. Among the birds of prey Short-eared owls are sometimes seen with Kestrels more commonly noticed.Buzzards have been recorded passing over this area in winter.
